40 static uint8_t get_device_id(struct in_addr ip_addr){
41  long mask = 0xFF ; /* create the mask: 0x00.00.00.FF or 0x00.00.00.00.00.00.00.FF depending of architecture*/
42  /* return the device ID */
43  return (htonl(ip_addr.s_addr)&mask);
44 }
45 
53 long define_vivoe_multicast( struct ethernetIfTableEntry *if_entry, const short int multicast_channel)
54 {
55  short device_id;
56  struct in_addr ip_addr;
57  /* constant values needed to build multicast address */
58  unsigned long multicast_pref = ntohl(inet_addr("239.192.0.0"));
59  unsigned long channel = (long) (multicast_channel << 8);
60  unsigned long result = -1; /* the multicast_addr in a binary form */
61 
62  if ( if_entry ){
63 
64  /* save ip in ip_addr */
65  ip_addr.s_addr = if_entry->ethernetIfIpAddress;
66  device_id = get_device_id(ip_addr);
67  result = multicast_pref + channel + device_id;
68 
69  } else{
70 
71  g_error("ERROR: Failed to retrieve IP on %s", get_primary_interface_name() );
72 
73  }
74 
75  if(result < 0){
76 
77  g_critical("Failed to generate multicast IP for udpsink, using default address: %s", DEFAULT_MULTICAST_ADDR );
78  return ntohl(inet_addr( DEFAULT_MULTICAST_ADDR ));
79 
80  }
81 
82  return ntohl(result);
83 }
